title: Real wild child: Australian rock music & culture 1950's-90's (PC & MAC)
creator_contributor_role: Real Wild Child Consortium, production company
subject_group: Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Interactive media
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Multimedia systems
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Popular culture
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Teenagers
Music & Performing Arts/Music - History and criticism
description: A wild, surreal, multimedia ride through five decades of Australian rock music, focusing on seven major eras. Stroll to the milkbar to experience the music of 1956-63. Sneak into a girl's bedroom to find out what was happening there between 1964-68. Take a trip to the hippie's house to discover the meaning of music during 1969-73. Front up to the TV studio to study the impact of what unfolded between 1974-77. Circle the perimeter of the room at the Hotel to get the low-down on the happenings of 1978-83. Gatecrash the nightclub to observe interesting phenomena occurring between 1984-89, until finally hauling your tired body into a deck chair in the 1990's garage to conclude the exploration. Fabulously presented, with informative snippets of information, excellent graphics and soundtrack, as well as cameos by some of Australia's most well known (and often notorious) identities. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: For Windows, 486 DX2/66 or better (Pentium recommended) running Windows 95 (recommended)/NT 4.0/Windows 3.1, 16 megabytes or more of RAM. Double speed or faster CD-ROM drive (Quad speed recommended), sound card (stereo 16-bit recommended), 640x480 Super VGA display (256 colour or better). For Macintosh 68040 or better (Power PC recommended) running Mac OS System 7.5 or later. 8 megabytes if application RAM, (ie. memory available after System requirements) double speed or faster CD-ROM drive (Quad speed recommended), 640x480 display (256 colour or better).
